[[Thunderbolts (comics)|Thunderbolts]] | aliases = '''Katrina Luisa Van Horn''': Amazon, Wilma | powers = '''Katrina Luisa Van Horn''': Superhuman strength and durability, and size-alteration through Pym Particle exposure | cat = super | subcat = Marvel Comics | hero = | villain = y | sortkey = Man-Killer | addcharcat# = }} '''Man-Killer''' is a name used by two [[supervillain]]s appearing in [[American comic book]]s published by [[Marvel Comics]]. The second version '''Katrina Luisa Van Horn''' has been viewed by critics as a "caricature of feminists, who [[Misandry|despised all men]]."{{cite book |last1=Wright |first1=Bradford W. |title=Comic Book Nation: The Transformation of Youth Culture in America |date=2001 |publisher=Johns Hopkins Press |isbn=9780801865145 |page=250}} ==Publication history== The first version of Man-Killer first appeared in ''[[Captain America (comic book)|Captain America]]'' #111 (December 1968) and created by [[Stan Lee]] and [[Jim Steranko]]. Man-Killer first appeared in ''[[Marvel Team-Up]]'' volume 1 #8 (April 1973) and created by [[Gerry Conway]] and [[Jim Mooney]].{{cite book |last1=Cowsill |first1=Alan |last2=Manning |first2=Matthew K. |title=Spider-Man Chronicle: Celebrating 50 Years of Web-Slinging |date=2012 |publisher=DK Publishing |isbn=978-0756692360 |page=67}} The character subsequently appeared in ''Daredevil'' vol. 1 #121 (May 1975), 123 (July 1975), ''[[Iron Man (comic book)|Iron Man]]'' vol. 1 #126-127 (September–October 1979), and ''Marvel Team-Up'' vol. 1 #107 (July 1981), where she seemingly died. The character appeared several years later in ''Web of Spider-Man Annual'' #3 (1987), and made several appearances in ''Thunderbolts'' vol. 1, including issues #3 (June 1997), #18-20 (August–November 1998), 23-25 (February–April 1999), 27 (June 1999), 30 (September 1999), 34-35 (January–February 2000), 39-42 (June–September 2000), and in ''Deadline'' #2 (July 2002). After joining the [[Thunderbolts (comics)|Thunderbolts]] and taking the name Amazon, she appeared in ''Thunderbolts'' vol. 1 #64-65 (July–August 2002), 67 (September 2002), 69 (October 2002), 71 (November 2002) ''Marvel Universe: The End'' #5-6 (July–August 2003), ''Thunderbolts'' vol. 1 #73-75 (December 2002-February 2003), 80-81 (August–September 2003), ''New Thunderbolts'' #18 (April 2006), and ''Thunderbolts'' vol. 2 #100 (May 2006). She received an entry in the ''Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A-Z 2006'' #7. ==Fictional character biography== ===Robot=== Mankiller was a robotic assassin sent by [[Viper (Madame Hydra)|Madame Hydra]] to kill [[Captain America]], but the robot is defeated and destroyed.''Captain America'' #111 ===Katrina Luisa Van Horn=== '''Katrina Luisa Van Horn''' was an [[Olympic Games|Olympic]] [[skiing|skier]] and is a militant [[feminism|feminist]]. After engaging in an argument with anti-Women's Liberation skier Karl Lubbings, the two took their disagreement to the slopes. Katrina was an Olympic-level skier, but Lubbings cut her off and both skiers plunged off the mountain. Katrina was severely injured and disfigured. She was fitted with a powered [[exoskeleton]] and took the name Man-Killer (she no longer wears the exoskeleton so it is probable her strength has been enhanced somehow).''Marvel Team Up'' #8 She has worked freelance and as an agent for [[Hydra (comics)|HYDRA]].''Daredevil'' #121-123 Man-Killer has been a member of the [[Masters of Evil]] under the [[Crimson Cowl]].''Thunderbolts'' #3''Thunderbolts'' #18-25 As '''Amazon''', she was briefly a member of the [[Thunderbolts (comics)|Thunderbolts]] under [[Hawkeye (Clint Barton)|Hawkeye]].''Thunderbolts'' #64-69 She had fought [[Spider-Man]] on some occasions.''Marvel Team Up'' #107''Thunderbolts'' #80-81 During an altercation with the Thunderbolts, Katrina told [[Songbird (comics)|Songbird]] that she'd rather not fight her, as she had no problems with women, just with men (Songbird attacked her anyway). Some time later however, [[Erik Josten]] (Atlas of the Thunderbolts) discovered Katrina working as a bartender in his team's adopted home of Burton Canyon, [[Colorado]]. When Josten became a regular at the bar Katrina was congenial towards him, pretending not to recognize him as Atlas. Whatever animosity Katrina may or may not bear towards men, she has proven herself capable of working alongside them with a minimum of personality conflicts.''Thunderbolts'' #27-35 Man-Killer is seen to be among the new recruits for [[Camp H.A.M.M.E.R.]]''Avengers: The Initiative'' #31 Man-Killer later appears as part of [[Helmut Zemo|Baron Helmut Zemo]]'s third incarnation of the Masters of Evil where they attacked the [[Bucky Barnes|Winter Soldier]]'s incarnation of the Thunderbolts.''Thunderbolts'' vol. 3 #10 During the "Opening Salvo" part of the ''[[Secret Empire (comics)|Secret Empire]]'' storyline, Man-Killer was involved in the Masters of Evil's next fight with the Thunderbolts which ends in her apparent death at the hands of [[List of Marvel Comics characters: K#Kobik|Kobik]].''Thunderbolts'' vol. 3 #12 ==Powers and abilities== Katrina Luisa Van Horn was given robotic implants replacing and/or compounded with bones and nerves, which give her superhuman powers, good athletic abilities, and the ability to throw knives at a range of hundreds of meters. She was also given [[Pym particles]] to grow in strength proportionate to size.''Thunderbolts'' #100 ==In other media== * The Robot version of Man-Killer appears in the ''[[Avengers Assemble (TV series)|Avengers Assemble]]'' episode "New Year's Resolution". This version is [[Kang the Conqueror]]'s time-travelling robotic assassin. Two pose as [[Hydra (comics)|Hydra]] agents to eliminate [[Howard Stark]], but one is destroyed by [[Peggy Carter]] and the other merged with the [[Iron Legion]] before being destroyed by its target.{{cite episode|title=New Year's Resolution|series=Avengers: Secret Wars|network=Disney XD|season=4|number=14|airdate=December 3, 2017}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.marvel.com/universe/Man-Killer Man-Killer] at Marvel.com * [http://www.spiderfan.org/characters/man_killer.html Man-Killer] at SpiderFan.org * [https://web.archive.org/web/20050302035402/http://www.leaderslair.com/marvelvillains/man-killer.html Leader's Lair] * {{Marvunapp|http://www.marvunapp.com/Appendix/mankl2.htm|Man-Killer}} * [http://www.gayleague.com/wordpress/amazon-man-killer/ Gay League Profile] {{Thunderbolts}} [[Category:Comics characters introduced in 1973]] [[Category:Fictional bartenders]] [[Category:Fictional blade and dart throwers]] [[Category:Fictional German people]] [[Category:Fictional Olympic competitors]] [[Category:Fictional skiers]] [[Category:Hydra (comics) agents]] [[Category:Marvel Comics characters with superhuman strength]] [[Category:Marvel Comics cyborgs]] [[Category:Marvel Comics mutates]]
